alert.note: Alert for Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 5:05PM EDT until June 22 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Lexington and Richland. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 504 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, West Columbia, Cayce, Forest Acres, Springdale, St. Andrews, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, SC State Fair Grounds, West Columbia Riverwalk, SC State Farmer`s Market, Five Points, Riverbanks Zoo, Columbia Metro Airport, Cayce Riverwalk, Dixiana, Olympia, Guignard Park, Silver Lake and Rosewood. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 2 and 3. Interstate 26 between mile markers 112 and 119. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 5. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Minor flooding may occur in the Five Points area extending downstream along Rocky Branch Creek. This includes Maxcy Gregg Park, areas of the USC campus along the creek, the intersection at Pickens and Blossom, the intersection at Whaley and Main and areas of the Olympia neighborhood along the creek.
